CatDescriptText: Mr. Alex Gray, steelworker, Homestead, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think taverns should be permitted to remain open and dispense alcohol beverages until at least 2 A.M. Sundays? Do you favor the sale of beer and wine on Sundays in Pennsylvania, like some other states permit?" answer reads: "Yes, because the mills, restaurants, and other places are open on Sundays.  And I think that it would be all right for the taverns to be open on Sundays because it would provide more jobs for people."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alex Gray wearing dark straw hat, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
